info.game_comments:
2007 College Championship quarterfinal game 4.
From the University of Southern California.

(1, 1).clue: Shelley & Eliot would be happy to know that April is the national month for this form of writing

(2, 1).clue: Proverbs 30 speaks of 4 things difficult to understand, including the flight of this bird of prey

(3, 1).clue: The deepest lake in the world(the country)

(4, 1).clue: This half-giant & "Keeper of the Keys" at Hogwarts has a pink umbrella that disguises his broken wand

(5, 1).clue: Meredith had a near-death experience & Izzie decided to practice medicine again on this show

(6, 1).clue: From the Latin for "write over", it's your official college record, with grades & courses taken

(1, 2).clue: The cotton gin worked by removing these small, pesky items from the cotton

(2, 2).clue: In Matthew 27, this Roman washes his hands to ritually absolve himself of Jesus' conviction & execution

(4, 2).clue: In 1899 she began her temperance work in Kansas wielding an umbrella; hatchets came later

(5, 2).clue: Gabrielle & Susan have multiple man problems on this show

(6, 2).clue: Not just for taxes, you can do this to a class to review material but not receive a grade

(1, 3).clue: If you stare at a bright red dot & then at a white wall, you'll see an afterimage of the same dot in this color

(2, 3).clue: Jeremiah spoke of the fall of Marduk when he predicted the downfall of this empire

(4, 3).clue: This fictional character arrives via an umbrella flight to become the Banks children's nanny

(5, 3).clue: On this show an Internet stripper has unnatural abilities that would appeal to a genetics professor

(6, 3).clue: Many schools have this large, scenic area; from Lumpkin Hall at Eastern Illinois, gaze upon the south one

(1, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from UC Santa Cruz.)  A membership program here at a UC Santa Cruz aquarium is named for the sea type of this creature--not to be confused with the banana type, the university's mascot

(2, 4).clue: Sometimes depicted with the bodies of lions, these temple angels were also found on top of the Ark of the Covenant

(4, 4).clue: The name of this small, light umbrella is from the Latin for "prepare for the sun"

(5, 4).clue: A Vicodin-addicted doctor faked cancer to get experimental medicine on this show

(6, 4).clue: The Stafford type of this is the most popular & federally guaranteed

(1, 5).clue: Disgraced soldiers once left the military with percussion playing--hence this modern idiom

(2, 5).clue: In Job 41, God compares Job's abilities with this monster of the sea

(4, 5).clue: This fictional castaway "spent a great deal of time and pains to make an umbrella" covered with skins

(5, 5).clue: FBI profiler Mandy Patinkin gets into the heads of the villains he tracks down on this show

(6, 5).clue: From the Latin for "east", these campus workshops introduce new students to college life

(1, 1).clue: As of Dec. 14, 1861 & until her death in 1901, this was Victoria's relationship status

(2, 1).clue: On New Year's Eve we should give thanks to this Scottish poet for his "Auld Lang Syne"

(3, 1).clue: Teddy Roosevelt laid the cornerstone of Roosevelt Arch, at the north entrance of this national park

(4, 1).clue: Make room for 10 lords a-leaping when you receive them as your tenth gift in this holiday song

(5, 1).clue: Even after their Grammy wins, this trio is "Not Ready To Make Nice""But I’ve always found my way somehow /By taking the long way around..."

(1, 2).clue: Under "heroes" is Louise Lehzen, her governess, who, like her royal house, came from this modern country

(2, 2).clue: He wrote, "The woods are lovely, dark and deep/ But I have promises to keep/ And miles to go before I sleep"

(3, 2).clue: Frank Gehry designed the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao in this country

(4, 2).clue: Exodus 12:29 reveals their death as the tenth plague brought upon the Egyptians

(5, 2).clue: Look for this Denver band if you want to know "How To Save A Life"

(1, 3).clue: The background is one of over a dozen portraits of herself done in honor of this June 28, 1838 ceremony

(2, 3).clue: His "Ode on a Grecian Urn" includes the line "Beauty is truth, truth beauty"

(3, 3).clue: You might say the statuesque residents of this South Pacific island have big heads & are always on holiday

(4, 3).clue: Serving from 1841 to 1845, the tenth president of the U.S. was this big Whig

(5, 3).clue: "Dance, Dance" for this band heard here"Dance, dance, we're falling apart to half time..."

(1, 4).clue: qVICki has 33 friends, including DIZee, this prime minister from 1874 to 1880

(2, 4).clue: It's the title of the Longfellow poem that begins, "Under the spreading chestnut tree"

(3, 4).clue: A gilt statue of this fire-stealer is at the heart of Rockefeller Center

(4, 4).clue: Before Julius Caesar's reforms, this was the tenth month in the Roman calendar

(5, 4).clue: This band found "All The Right Reasons" "Far Away" in Canada

(1, 5).clue: The music is this song, on which Felix Mendelssohn once improvised for Her Majesty

(2, 5).clue: Among his poetry collections is 1942's "Shakespeare in Harlem"

(3, 5).clue: Austrian architect Alfred Preis designed the memorial over this WWII battleship

(4, 5).clue: Plato called this female poet the "tenth muse"

(5, 5).clue: If you're in trouble, send an "S.O.S." to this woman"Come Mr. DJ song pon de replay /Come Mr. DJ won't you turn the music up..."

(6, 5).clue: conj.(2 words: a part of speech & the inflection of a verb)

(0, 0).clue: It's the name of the person next in the line of presidential succession after Robert Byrd
